Reader picture.

Friday 8.3. The Women's Day demonstration march was again seen in Tampere with extensive participation. We publish the pictures we receive as part of this news. The demonstration gathered at 6 pm at Tullintori "Down!" And "forward toward the revolutionary female movement!" Behind, for Palestine, as the symbols showing solidarity, the march is placed and other emblem follows along the procession.

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

March at the departure from Tullintori (reader photo).

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

Independence Street (reader picture).

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

Independence Street (reader picture).

During the march, screams, such as "imperialism and patriarchy, were shouted!", "The government down!", "Down the female hatred!", Down down imperialism, down down Zionism! "," From the river to the sea, freedom to Palestine! "," Long live the proletarian feminism ! ” And "Long live the armed resistance of Palestinian women!".

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

In the tunnel (photo: Fereydoun Bahramnoor).

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

Hämeensilta (photo: Fereydoun Bahramnoor).

An attempt was made to disturb the march from the outside, but there was no documentation of the firms of the recession civilians as the loud and otherwise powerful demonstration buried them in cadres. When the demonstration arrived at Keskustori, speeches were heard from the march organizers and supporters. Police disturbed the speech for a moment with their sirens, but otherwise stayed on the sidelines.

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

At the Central Market (reader picture).

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

At the Central Market (reader picture).

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

At the Central Market (reader picture).

Sumud-A representative of the Finnish Palestinian Network spoke about a side of the genocide of Israel about women. The trade union movement was heard from a representative of the JHL local department, who highlighted the history of Women's Day. The demonstration and its arrangements included various parties from the left movement, which also made their speech. Palestini, the position of women in working life, and weakening of the government in rights and living conditions were repeated themes in the speeches. The Speech of the Maoists set these and other topical issues in the context of the imperialist world system and the patriarchy, revealed the services of bourgeois feminism to women's majority deprivation, setting it with proletarian feminism, when a solution to the revolution as a solution and the ideology and party required by it. The speech also received praise from those who had more or less disagree. In general, the demonstration march and the subsequent speeches were realized in a good spirit, which corresponds to the ever -heavier need for a revolutionary female movement.

<The image of this location is in the list above, but in order to protect the site's traffic costs, it cannot be displayed here, sorry.>

At the Central Market (reader picture).
title: TRE: International Women's Day
author: lipunkantaja
